column4: it's rather irritating that my isp won't let me hook up a modem that I own and use that >_>
If your in US, who is your ISP?
Charter :(
Big ol' cable company rusivi

I have two computers here, neither have wifi cards (I didn't get one for mine and the other is rather old) ... yeah, I wanted both to be connected but apparently what I said was "charge me for another line"

I'm an ISP'er, usually they have something called a "custmod" that allows customers to use their own modem. However, it was my understanding they are required to allow it due to FCC competitive purposes.
One of these for TV CableCards called Seperable Security (US Law governing it)
maybe >_>  I connected it up but it won't go and tries to load into their silly isp install, obviously this modem is somehow not authorized
Yes you have to call Charter and request that they authorize it.
do you know if they have to have a technician come over or?
worried they'll just "add another line" instead and charge me double
they're real jerks
Usually you just return any eq they gave you and they just send a signal down without a site visit.
yeah returned the second one but I need to use two different ones.  I should call them but I hate talking to them >_>
my expectations were basically that the whole house has the signal coming to it so why couldn't I just add an extra? :P
That's nice you feel that way but if you want to add it, you have to call ur ISP and ask them to authorize it ;)
any idea if that costs money or not?  Pretty sure the modem is up to snuff, it's a few years old but I think it's perfectly capable

It's a no cost transaction. As well, if your ISP is using DOCSIS 3.0 (newest standard) and your modem is only DOCSIS 1.1 you may not get fastest speeds. Anyway you slice it, have to call and ask Charter.
alas alas :(
i'm kinda curious, do they just flick a switch and have the signal ungate?
Pretty much it's just a couple clicks of the mouse/keyboard.
I'm not usually the decision-y making one/pay the bills guy (I'm 20 hah) and I was totally distraught at them (charter) charging for a whole extra line.  really burned me out
